Definition

Crops a BitmapSource.

Remarks

CroppedBitmap implements the ISupportInitialize interface to optimize initialization on multiple properties. Property changes can occur only during object initialization. Call BeginInit to signal that initialization has begun and EndInit to signal that initialization has completed. After initialization, property changes are ignored.

CroppedBitmap objects created by using the CroppedBitmap(BitmapSource, Int32Rect) constructor are automatically initialized, and properties cannot be changed.

Metadata tags related to image data must be updated if an image is saved to a file after a transform is applied.

Use the SourceRect property of this class to define the area of the bitmap that is to be cropped.

Constructors

CroppedBitmap()

Initializes a new instance of the CroppedBitmap class.

public CroppedBitmap ();

Remarks

CroppedBitmap implements the ISupportInitialize interface to optimize initialization on multiple properties. To initialize a CroppedBitmap created using this constructor, you must perform property initialization between BeginInit and EndInit calls.

CroppedBitmap(BitmapSource, Int32Rect)

Initializes a new instance of the CroppedBitmap class that has the specified stem.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap.Source* and stem.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap.SourceRect*.

public CroppedBitmap (System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource source, System.Windows.Int32Rect sourceRect);
Parameters
source
BitmapSource

The stem.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap.Source* of the new CroppedBitmap instance.

sourceRect
Int32Rect

The stem.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap.SourceRect* of the new CroppedBitmap instance.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

Occurs when source is null.

Remarks

CroppedBitmap objects created using this constructor are automatically initialized. After initialization, property changes are ignored.

Fields

SourceProperty

Identifies the stem.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap.Source* dependency property.

public static readonly System.Windows.DependencyProperty SourceProperty;

SourceRectProperty

Identifies the stem.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap.SourceRect* dependency property.

public static readonly System.Windows.DependencyProperty SourceRectProperty;

Properties

Source

Gets or sets the source for the bitmap.

public System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource Source { get; set; }
Value
BitmapSource

The source for the bitmap. The default value is null.

Remarks

You can chain a CroppedBitmap to another BitmapSource by setting the Source property of the CroppedBitmap to the appropriate BitmapSource. For more information about chaining, see How to: Chain BitmapSource Objects Together.

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field SourceProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

SourceRect

Gets or sets the rectangular area that the bitmap is cropped to.

public System.Windows.Int32Rect SourceRect { get; set; }
Value
Int32Rect

The rectangular area that the bitmap is cropped to. The default is stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Empty*.

Remarks

A CroppedBitmap with a SourceRect set to Empty will render the entire image.

A rectangle that is not fully within the bounds of the bitmap will not render.

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field SourceRectProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

Methods

BeginInit()

Signals the start of the CroppedBitmap initialization.

public void BeginInit ();
Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

The CroppedBitmap is currently being initialized. BeginInit has already been called.

-or-

The CroppedBitmap has already been initialized.

Remarks

Property initialization must be done between BeginInit and EndInit calls. Once the CroppedBitmap has been initialized, property changes are ignored.

Clone()

Creates a modifiable clone of this CroppedBitmap, making deep copies of this object's values. When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.

public System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap Clone ();
Returns
CroppedBitmap

A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property will be false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property was true.

Remarks

This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.

For more information, see Clone.
